page.title: 05Anstruther Fishing
page.content: In the 30's about 65 steam drifters, catching herring regularly used our local habours providing 60% of the population with employment. But since then there has been a gradual decline and only about 15 small creel boats, catching shellfish, regularly use the harbours today. No more than 10% of the population are employed in the 1985 Anstruther Fishing Industry. Most of the local fishermen now operate from Pittenweem. Although some bigger boats do come in, they do not stay long and the harbours at Cellardyke and Anstruther are mostly used by enthusiasts "messing about in boats". If you wish to go angling you can catch coddling and pottleys from the harbour or you can pay about Â£5 to go out a mile or so in a small boat.
